FuncDef:
The optical-module alarm-threshold standardization enable command enables alarm threshold standardization for optical modules.
The undo optical-module alarm-threshold standardization enable command cancels alarm threshold standardization for optical modules.
By default, alarm threshold standardization is disabled for optical modules.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable alarm threshold standardization for optical modules, run the optical-module threshold-standardization enable command. Enabling alarm threshold standardization implements optical power-related alarm threshold standardization and changes the mode of obtaining thresholds for sending and receiving optical power. If the optical-module threshold-standardization enable command is not run, thresholds are calculated based on data read from the optical module registers, which is the default mode of obtaining a threshold. If the optical-module threshold-standardization enable command is run, optical power thresholds use a standardized value that is calculated based on the optical module transmission distance and bandwidth.
Precautions
The optical-module threshold-standardization enable command configuration is effective only for interfaces that have optical-interface-equipped optical modules.
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
